Key Arguments: The interpretation of misinformation and disinformation is subjective and influenced by confirmation bias.
Limiting access to information can cause more harm than good and stifle open debate and critical thinking.
Historical examples show that restricting information can lead to societal harm and state capture.
The proposed legislation could lead to censorship and limit freedom of expression.
Education and critical thinking should be prioritized over legislative restrictions to combat misinformation.
Main Themes: Role of Education in Combating Misinformation
Notable Quotes: This Bill must be withdrawn and emphasis placed on education that will enable our society/communities to evaluate information in a fair and all encompassing manner.
Laws that limit the availability of on-line information are the equivalent to burning books historically.
Who judges what is mis/dis-information? Who decides what is harm and which action has potential for harm?
